Description: Greek terracotta figure of a woman. Her wavy hair is parted in the middle and drawn back under a cap. Pierced ear on the left side. Mould-made from a two-piece mould and hollow. Traces of a white coating and red paint on hair. Soft pink-brown clay with a grey core, rare silver mica inclusions and a soapy texture. Head fragment only, missing back and badly eroded.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Dated to 'about 400BC-350 BC', with parallels from Cyprus (Gutch, 1898-9, 81, no.40; Caubet et al 1998, no. 1025). Caubet, A., Fourrier, S. and Queyrel, A. 1998. L'art des modeleurs d'argile: Antiquités de Chypre, coroplastique. Vol, 2. Paris: Musée du Louvre.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 81, no. 40)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.365) (Phase 3)
